intro: Erigeron myrionactis, commonly known as the desert fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations such as hairy leaves and a deep root system to conserve water. Its small, daisy-like flowers bloom in shades of white and yellow, often attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Erigeron myrionactis is also known for its resilience to drought and poor soil conditions, making it a hardy species in harsh environments.
